ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This is a great way to learn about screenwriting by trying your hand at it. Professor Lapadula is passionate, personable, and knowledgeable, and he's a great person to get to know. Try to take this as a sophomore in case you want to follow through the progression to advanced screenwriting.
The best class I've taken at Yale. If you can get into it, take it. It's worth the work.
Yes take it! The midterm folder is a lot of work but it is worth it. You are forced to read a lot of screenplays, which in the end helps you write your own.
Fun class, you learn important screenwriting basics. If you are interested in a career in screenwriting, learning coverage is also useful.
I highly recommend it. It is a fun course, and a reasonable amount of work.

An introductory screenwriting class that meets once a week. You have to meet with a group outside of class, and the members in your group are randomly assigned, but so important. If you have a group that's motivated, great; if you don't, things might get hard.
